intro: Lastrea gracilis, commonly known as the slender lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptations, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
